Context:
Program Name: Personal Support Worker
Code: C112
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Duration: 2 semesters
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $3,899.00 *
Centre: Health Sciences
School: Sally Horsfall Eaton School of Nursing
Location: Waterfront Campus
Method of Study: Full-time
Program Description: George Brown College's Personal Support Worker (PSW) program is a two-semester course that teaches students the skills required to provide personal care for the elderly, chronically ill, and individuals with accessibility challenges. PSWs assist clients with their personal and household needs to ensure their comfort and safety. Clients may live in the community, long-term care facilities, or ambulatory care settings.
Classes are held online and on-site at the Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences located at the Waterfront Campus.
Program Overview: George Brown College has been offering PSW training for over 20 years.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Personal Support Worker Program (PSW) C112 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Personal Support Worker (PSW) program at the college prepares students to work with various populations, including the elderly, chronically ill, physically disabled, people in long-term care facilities, select ambulatory care settings, people in acute medical and surgical settings, and those receiving palliative care. Students will complete supervised clinical placements in institutional and community settings, as well as an interprofessional Simulation Centre experience. Clinical practicums take place in various settings across the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) and may include day or evening shifts.

After completing the PSW program, graduates can find employment in ambulatory care settings, long-term care facilities, residential and supportive housing, community support agencies, acute medical settings, and palliative care settings. PSW graduates who wish to continue their education and enter the nursing profession can apply to George Brown College's PSW Pathway to Practical Nursing program or apply directly to the Practical Nursing program. Graduates with an interest in working in long-term care facilities should consider applying to the Interprofessional Complex and Long-Term Care postgraduate certificate, which is delivered online and includes a clinical field placement component.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Personal Support Worker Program (PSW) C112 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the courses offered in Semesters 1 and 2 of the Personal Support Worker (PSW) program at the college. Here's a summary of the factual information:

Courses:
- Required Courses for Semester 1: PSW 1001, PSW 1017, PSW 1019, PSW 1022, PSW 1023, PSW 1024, PSW 1025
- Required Courses for Semester 2: CARE 1101, CARE 1103, CARE 1112, CARE 1113, CARE 1114, CARE 1115
- Note: Curriculum review in progress, course titles may change without notice.

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Graduates will be able to work within the PSW role in community, retirement homes, long-term care homes and/or hospital care settings according to legislation and employer guidelines.
- Graduates will act responsibly and accountably while recognizing the boundaries of their knowledge and skills.
- Graduates will collaborate with clients, families, supervisors, and other interprofessional team members in providing supportive care.
- Graduates will provide client-centered and client-directed care based on ethical principles and sensitive to diverse values, beliefs, and needs.
- Graduates will establish and maintain helping relationships with clients and families while adhering to confidentiality and privacy legislation.
- Graduates will identify relevant client information using basic assessment and communication skills and document findings according to employer policies and all applicable legislation.

No other factual information was found in the text.

Context:
The text describes various duties and responsibilities of individuals working in a caregiving role at the college. Here are some factual information extracted from the text:

- The document should be in accordance with employer policies, procedures, and legislation.
- Maintain a safe and comfortable environment for clients and implement infection prevention and control measures and emergency first aid procedures.
- Assist clients with routine activities of daily living, medication administration, household management tasks, and instrumental activities of daily living.
- Report situations of neglect and incidents of abuse.
- Provide culturally relevant palliative and end-of-life care to clients and their families.
- Support positive and safe behavior in clients with cognitive impairments, mental health challenges, or responsive behaviors.
- Tuition for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022 is $3,899.
- Financial assistance information for the program starting in Fall 2023 is available but subject to change and tuition fees are subject to board approval.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Personal Support Worker Program (PSW) C112 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The text provides information about financial assistance for a program at George Brown College that is approved for OSAP funding. Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, including grade 12 English (C or U), or mature student status with the option to take an admissions assessment or upgrade English credits. Course exemptions may be possible through college or university credits, but this program is open only to domestic applicants. Students who are accepted into the program must meet and complete mandatory pre-placement requirements including medical records, a police vulnerable sector check renewed every six months, standard first aid certificate renewed every three years, CPR level HCP renewed every year, annual flu shot, and mask fit test renewed every two years. These requirements are designed to protect clients and vulnerable populations and students who do not comply with them may be excluded from clinical practicum. The text includes the following factual entities: OSAP, George Brown College, Ontario Secondary School Diploma, grade 12 English, mature student status, Admissions Assessment, English credits, transfer guide, ParaMed, medical records (MMR, Varicella, Hep B blood test reports/titres, Tdap shot valid every 10 years and two-step TB skin test), police vulnerable sector check, standard first aid certificate, CPR level HCP, annual flu shot, mask fit test.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Personal Support Worker Program (PSW) C112 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
* Students are required to have a Police Vulnerable Sector Check completed and renewed every six months for clinical or field placements.
* The process can take between 2-8 months.
* Students are responsible for paying the fees associated with the check.
* Clinical agency partners require students to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 for approval of clinical placements.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
